intro: Aconitum kusnezoffii var. ochotense, commonly known as the Siberian monkshood, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Eastern Siberia and northern Mongolia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its striking, hood-shaped blue to purple flowers. The plant features large, palmately lobed leaves that are deeply divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Due to its toxicity, it should be handled with care.
